title: AWS SecurityHub
description: AWS Security Hub provides you with a comprehensive view of your security state within AWS and your compliance with the security industry standards and best practices. Security Hub collects security data from across AWS accounts, services, and supported third-party partners and helps you analyze your security trends and identify the highest priority security issues. For more information, see AWS Security Hub User Guide.

DisableSecurityHub.title: Disables the AWS Security Hub Service.
DisableSecurityHub.description: Disables the AWS Security Hub Service.

EnableSecurityHub.title: Enables the AWS Security Hub service.
EnableSecurityHub.description: Enables the AWS Security Hub service.

UpdateFindings.title: Updates the AWS Security Hub-aggregated findings specified by the filter attributes.
UpdateFindings.description: Updates the AWS Security Hub-aggregated findings specified by the filter attributes.

GetFindings.title: Lists and describes Security Hub-aggregated findings that are specified by filter attributes.
GetFindings.description: Lists and describes Security Hub-aggregated findings that are specified by filter attributes.

BatchImportFindings.title: Imports security findings that are generated by the integrated third-party products into Security Hub.
BatchImportFindings.description: Imports security findings that are generated by the integrated third-party products into Security Hub.

CreateInsight.title: Creates an insight, which is a consolidation of findings that identifies a security area that requires attention or intervention.
CreateInsight.description: Creates an insight, which is a consolidation of findings that identifies a security area that requires attention or intervention.

GetInsights.title: Lists and describes insights that are specified by insight ARNs.
GetInsights.description: Lists and describes insights that are specified by insight ARNs.

GetInsightResults.title: Lists the results of the Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.
GetInsightResults.description: Lists the results of the Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.

DeleteInsight.title: Deletes an insight that is specified by the insight ARN.
DeleteInsight.description: Deletes an insight that is specified by the insight ARN.

UpdateInsight.title: Updates the AWS Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.
UpdateInsight.description: Updates the AWS Security Hub insight specified by the insight ARN.

ListInvitations.title: Lists all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current AWS account.
ListInvitations.description: Lists all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current AWS account.

GetInvitationsCount.title: Returns the count of all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current member account, not including the currently accepted invitation.
GetInvitationsCount.description: Returns the count of all Security Hub membership invitations that were sent to the current member account, not including the currently accepted invitation.

DeclineInvitations.title: Declines invitations that are sent to this AWS account (invitee) by the AWS accounts (inviters) that are specified by the account IDs.
DeclineInvitations.description: Declines invitations that are sent to this AWS account (invitee) by the AWS accounts (inviters) that are specified by the account IDs.

DeleteInvitations.title: Deletes invitations that are sent to this AWS account (invitee) by the AWS accounts (inviters) that are specified by their account IDs.
DeleteInvitations.description: Deletes invitations that are sent to this AWS account (invitee) by the AWS accounts (inviters) that are specified by their account IDs.

GetMasterAccount.title: Provides the details for the Security Hub master account to the current member account.
GetMasterAccount.description: Provides the details for the Security Hub master account to the current member account.

AcceptInvitation.title: Accepts the invitation to be monitored by a master SecurityHub account.
AcceptInvitation.description: Accepts the invitation to be monitored by a master SecurityHub account.

DisassociateFromMasterAccount.title: Disassociates the current Security Hub member account from its master account.
DisassociateFromMasterAccount.description: Disassociates the current Security Hub member account from its master account.

ListMembers.title: Lists details about all member accounts for the current Security Hub master account.
ListMembers.description: Lists details about all member accounts for the current Security Hub master account.

CreateMembers.title: Creates member Security Hub accounts in the current AWS account (which becomes the master Security Hub account) that has Security Hub enabled.
CreateMembers.description: Creates member Security Hub accounts in the current AWS account (which becomes the master Security Hub account) that has Security Hub enabled.

DeleteMembers.title: Deletes the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs.
DeleteMembers.description: Deletes the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs.

DisassociateMembers.title: Disassociates the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs from their master account.
DisassociateMembers.description: Disassociates the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs from their master account.

GetMembers.title: Returns the details on the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs.
GetMembers.description: Returns the details on the Security Hub member accounts that are specified by the account IDs.

InviteMembers.title: Invites other AWS accounts to enable Security Hub and become Security Hub member accounts. When an account accepts the invitation and becomes a member account, the master account can view Security Hub findings of the member account.
InviteMembers.description: Invites other AWS accounts to enable Security Hub and become Security Hub member accounts. When an account accepts the invitation and becomes a member account, the master account can view Security Hub findings of the member account.

ListEnabledProductsForImport.title: Lists all Security Hub-integrated third-party findings providers.
ListEnabledProductsForImport.description: Lists all Security Hub-integrated third-party findings providers.

EnableImportFindingsForProduct.title: Enables you to import findings generated by integrated third-party providers into Security Hub.
EnableImportFindingsForProduct.description: Enables you to import findings generated by integrated third-party providers into Security Hub.

DisableImportFindingsForProduct.title: Stops you from being able to import findings generated by integrated third-party providers into Security Hub.
DisableImportFindingsForProduct.description: Stops you from being able to import findings generated by integrated third-party providers into Security Hub.

BatchDisableStandards.title: Disables the standards specified by the standards subscription ARNs. In the context of Security Hub, supported standards (for example, CIS AWS Foundations) are automated and continuous checks that help determine your compliance status against security industry (including AWS) best practices.
BatchDisableStandards.description: Disables the standards specified by the standards subscription ARNs. In the context of Security Hub, supported standards (for example, CIS AWS Foundations) are automated and continuous checks that help determine your compliance status against security industry (including AWS) best practices.

BatchEnableStandards.title: Enables the standards specified by the standards ARNs. In the context of Security Hub, supported standards (for example, CIS AWS Foundations) are automated and continuous checks that help determine your compliance status against security industry (including AWS) best practices.
BatchEnableStandards.description: Enables the standards specified by the standards ARNs. In the context of Security Hub, supported standards (for example, CIS AWS Foundations) are automated and continuous checks that help determine your compliance status against security industry (including AWS) best practices.
